--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "legatusbiz" <legatusbiz@y...>
wrote:
> 
> Hello to all of you,
> 
> I made a search here to find someone with the same problem.
> Found one thread describing the same problem but couldn't resolve
it.
> Can someone please help?
> I'm running Fedora Core3.
> The Heritrix resides in /usr/local/heritrix/
> When trying to start Heritrix in the bin folder with the command
> ./heritrix I get this - "Sun Mar 27 11:15:14 CEST 2005 Starting
> heritrix.......................................................
> ................
> .
> .
> " 
> Heritrix can't start.
> Do I have do export path for heritrix? Do I have to config a file or
> is it enough type this :
> # export HERITRIX_HOME=/usr/local/heritrix/
> 
> The same thing goes for exporting the java envoirment.
> I don't have java where the example is showing in "2.2.2.2.
JAVA_HOME"
> Anyone with the same problem running Fedora ?
> 
> Would really appreciate any help.

Hi,

I am running on the Fedora Core2 with JDK 1.5.  Never have the
problem.  Anyway, here is the script I am using to start, I use it as
explain somewhere in the forum for multiple instances.

./runcrawler.sh 8801 (it will starts on port 8801 and use the config
file heritrix-8801.properties under config directory

-bash-2.05b$ less runcrawler 
===================================================
#!/bin/sh

export HERITRIX_HOME=/home/jay/heritrix-1.2.0
export JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/current

if [ "$#" -eq 0 ]
then
echo "Usage $0 PORT"
exit 1
fi

PROPS_DIR=$HERITRIX_HOME/conf/heritrix-${1}.properties

if [ ! -f $PROPS_DIR ]
then
echo "Error: the properties file for port $1 does not exist."
exit 1
fi

export HERITRIX_OUT=$HERITRIX_HOME/heritrix_${1}_out.log
export JAVA_OPTS="-Xmx512m -Dheritrix.properties=$PROPS_DIR"
$HERITRIX_HOME/bin/heritrix

==============================

Good Luck,
Jay
